required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Muscle Injuries With Physium Therapy.
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Muscle Injuries With Physium Therapy.

brief_summary.textblock:
Muscle injuries are currently particularly frequent among people who participate in sports.
The diagnosis is easily made with an ultrasound study and Shear Wave Elastography.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients of the experimental group, after diagnosis by ultrasound and Shear Wave Elastography , will receive five sessions of physium therapy at 80 millibars during one month.
The measurements of the variables visual analog scale, joint mobility through the double inclinometer device, elasticity and tissue vascularization through the ultrasound, quality of life through SF-12 questionnaire and pressure algometry will be made before, after, month and three months after the end of treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: RANDOMIZED CLINICAL TRIAL WITH BLIND EVALUATION BY THIRD PARTIES, LONGITUDINAL AND PROSPECTIVE.

primary_outcome.measure: Time necessary to return to full sport participation.
primary_outcome.description: Time necessary to return to full sport participation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time necessary to return to full sport participation.
secondary_outcome.description: Time necessary to return to full sport participation.

A 10-point Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NPRS; 0: no pain, 10: maximum pain) will be used to assess the patients' current level of pain, and the worst and lowest level of pain experienced in the preceding week in the area.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pressure pain thresholds in cervical trigger points
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure pain thresholds (PPTs) will be measured with a pressure algometer
The multidimensional health related quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: the extent of sports-related muscle injuries
secondary_outcome.description: Imaging is crucial to confirm and assess the extent of sports-related muscle injuries and may help to guide management.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive five sessions of physium therapy at 80 millibars in 30 minutes for a month

intervention.description: patients will receive five sessions of physium therapy at 80 millibars in 30 minutes for one month in muscle injury and diagnosed by ultrasound and Shear Wave Elastography.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients of both sexes, aged between 20 and 60 years, in an active state of pain and diagnosed with muscle breakdown.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are pregnant, have pacemakers and surgically operated in the area to be treated.
